div1.p: Heilbron sends Hench an article about Walter Reed, published by the Minnesota Historical Society.

div1.head: Letter from Bertha L. Heilbron to Philip Showalter Hench, October 12, 1943
div1.opener:
MINNESOTA HISTORICAL SOCIETY
Saint Paul
October 12, 1943
Zone 1.
Minnesota History
ARTHUR J. LARSEN, EDITOR
BERTHA L. HEILBRON, ASSISTANT EDITOR
Lt. Col. Philip S. Hench
Station Hospital
Camp Carson, Colorado
Dear Col. Hench:
div1.p:
Under separate cover we are sending you a compli-
mentary copy of the September issue of Minnesota
History. I am pleased to know that you found the
Walter Reed article of interest.

I have your name on a list of people to whom
I had intended sending separates of the article. We
cannot afford the making of reprints, but we make up a
few separates here from unbound copies. Unfortunately,
these are not yet ready for distribution. I intend
to send copies to the various people who assisted me
by providing suggestions and material for the article.
Included on my list is General Reed, Dr. Walter Reed's
son. I do not, however, have any of the other names
which you mention. If I have any separates left after
taking care of the people to whom I feel obligated,
I shall be happy to send them on to you. Perhaps it
might be well for us to compare lists in order to
prevent overlapping.

I learned with regret of the recent death of
Dr. Wilson. It was his little article on public
health that first aroused my interest in this subject.

I shall appreciate greatly receiving your paper
on Walter Reed and yellow fever.
